posts.cooked:
Hi,

Trying to get Signal to work with Dutch Vodafone data sim card. The sim allows to receive SMS text messages (just no voice calls), but instead of an 11-digit +316‚Ä¶ number, it has a 13-digit +319‚Ä¶ number.

Signal gives ‚Äúinvalid number‚Äù error before even to try and send a text message, so cannot validate.

Request to change te check on phone number lenght in The Netherlands to allow this.

It works perfectly fine in whatsapp, so I hope no reason for Signal not to support it.

Thanks!
Har

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 4.67 release

posts.cooked: If this is true, this is in my humble opinion should not be to dealt as feature request, but instead it should be seen as bug report. It is a defect and it should be fixed with greater priority. All of the regular phone numbers should be able to register with Signal.

Well, I thought about it, but since it is a number that can only receive text messages and no voice calls, I opted for the feature request.

But a bit of priority would be nice
+1 for this request, my kids are on data-only plans and I need to get them off WhatsApp

posts.name: Johanw666
posts.cooked: Just out of curiosity, what is the reason to use such a simcard in a normal phone? Is it much cheaper that voice + data combined, even with very few or even 0 calling minutes?

Depends on the plan. I still had 2 data sims connected to my phone subscription laying around, so it was easy and at no extra cost to put them in a phone for the kids.

This request was done ages ago, and I think it is 10 minutes to fix the phone number check, but it seems it won‚Äôt be picked up. So they are on whatsapp‚Ä¶ but I‚Äôd rather have them on Signal.

posts.name: Arik
posts.cooked:
johanw666:

what is the reason to use such a simcard in a normal phone

I have a friend who got it as well, some companies (T-Mobile is the one I‚Äôve seen) issue those specifically for tablets that you get on a lease from the provider.

image2360√ó1444 158 KB

is it possible to send a debug log?
It is interesting with which technical error message the number is rejected.

Panjerossi:

This request was done ages ago, and I think it is 10 minutes to fix the phone number check, but it seems it won‚Äôt be picked up. So they are on whatsapp‚Ä¶ but I‚Äôd rather have them on Signal.

If that would have happened with WhatsApp, and you would have written a bug report to their service, it would have been fixed after 2-3 weeks.

I don‚Äôt know, why the developers ignored that feature request, but that happens quite often. Sadly.

posts.name: Johanw666
posts.cooked: Eventually the validation is done in a Google library (com.google.i18n.phonenumbers.PhoneNumberUtil) so either Google has to change its code or someone has to make a custom version without any phone number validity check.

They seem to have done something additional for US/Brazil numbers. Maybe modifying this is all that‚Äôs needed? Having the debug log to find exact error message would be useful.

github.com

signalapp/Signal-Android/blob/main/libsignal/service/src/main/java/org/whispersystems/signalservice/api/util/PhoneNumberFormatter.java#L38


      
    
          
  1. 
          
  2. private static final String TAG = PhoneNumberFormatter.class.getSimpleName();
    3. 
          
  3. 
          
  4. private static final String COUNTRY_CODE_BR = "55";
    5. 
          
  5. private static final String COUNTRY_CODE_US = "1";
    6. 
          
  6. 
          
  7. public static boolean isValidNumber(String e164Number, String countryCode) {
    8. 
          
  8.   if (!PhoneNumberUtil.getInstance().isPossibleNumber(e164Number, countryCode)) {
    9. 
          
  9.     Log.w(TAG, "Failed isPossibleNumber()");
    10. 
          
  10.     return false;
    11. 
          
  11.   }
    12. 
          
  12. 
          
  13.   if (COUNTRY_CODE_US.equals(countryCode) && !Pattern.matches("^\\+1[0-9]{10}$", e164Number)) {
    14. 
          
  14.     Log.w(TAG, "Failed US number format check");
    15. 
          
  15.     return false;
    16. 
          
  16.   }
    17. 
          
  17. 
          
  18.   if (COUNTRY_CODE_BR.equals(countryCode) && !Pattern.matches("^\\+55[0-9]{2}9?[0-9]{8}$", e164Number)) {
    19. 
          
  19.     Log.w(TAG, "Failed Brazil number format check");
    20. 
          
  20.     return false;
    21. 
          
  21.   }
    22.

Found that github issue with dutch mobile numbers +31 97 ‚Ä¶

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android

Dutch data-only phone numbers are not recognized as valid

opened 08:05PM - 31 Aug 19 UTC
closed 12:27PM - 13 May 22 UTC
ActiveB1t
acknowledged

- [x] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates - [x] I am submitti‚Ä¶ng a bug report for existing functionality that does not work as intended - [x] I have read https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/wiki/Submitting-useful-bug-reports - [x] This isn't a feature request or a discussion topic ---------------------------------------- ### Bug description Registering a standard Dutch data-only phone number is not recognized as valid. These numbers are able to receive and send SMS. ### Steps to reproduce - Install Signal, or unregister old phone number - Enable Signal messages and calls option - Choose Netherlands as country (+31) - Enter data-only phone number, starting with 97 followed by 9 digits **Actual result:** An error message appears, indicating the number is invalid. **Expected result:** The number should be recognized as valid and the next step in the registration should start, presumable receiving a verification SMS. ### Screenshots ![Screenshot_20190831-215648](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/54752335/64068640-0b865300-cc3b-11e9-97bb-ccbd96c7d86b.png) ### Device info **Device:** Google Pixel 2 XL **Android version:** 9 **Signal version:** 4.46.2 ### Link to debug log https://debuglogs.org/c5781749fc57563f412ab5d9448eb8dd1fe55744a04d0455f9767b49d932c344

EDIT:

Now also for signal4ios.

github.com/signalapp/Signal-iOS

Dutch 13-digit data-only numbers are not accepted

opened 05:40PM - 25 Apr 20 UTC
closed 01:47PM - 31 Jan 22 UTC
bartv42
wontfix

On Dutch phones, only 11-digit +31 6 xxx numbers are accepted during registratio‚Ä¶n. Data-only plans with the 13-digit +31 9 xxx numbers are rejected. These can receive SMS messages, but not voice calls. Note that other platforms like WhatsApp and Telegram do accept these numbers.

posts.cooked:
Going through the comments in the bug report it seems like the function I pointed out is exactly the one that needs to be modified. Although there could still be an issue with sending the SMS the current error should disappear.

The devs are waiting for Google to fix it.
